title.narrative: COMMUNICATIONS, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnerships for social and behaviour change

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issueswith stakeholders

description.narrative: CO continued communication and advocacy on key programmatic areas ;in the context of ongoing pandemic and new Country Programme ;with focus on Early Childhood Development and Risk Communication messaging, and effectively harnessed key milestones such as UNICEF@75, World Children’s Day,Global Forum for Children and Youthand other national events,and applied new approaches (livestreams), which significantly increased its follower base on various channels and strengthened its partnerships with stakeholders in 2021; | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2022
